description: '''Harsh noise''' is a [[subgenre]] of [[noise music]] that emerged in the early 1980s, originating from the [[Kansai no wave]] movement and later [[Japanoise]], primarily through acts such as [[Merzbow]], [[Hijokaidan]], [[Hanatarash]], [[C.C.C.C. (band)|C.C.C.C.]] and [[Incapacitants]], and was further developed by the European [[Power electronics (music genre)|power electronics]] scene and American [[Noise music|noise]] musicians such as [[the Haters]], [[Daniel Menche]], and [[Richard Ramirez (musician)|Richard Ramirez]].
top_artists: To Live and Shave in L.A.
